  "Broker Comment" : "PAINE WEBBER MAY HAVE ERRED IN ENTERING THIS ON THE DRP IN THAT THE EXACT LANGUAGE OF THE COMPLAINT LETTER, WHICH WAS CRIPTICALLY HANDWRITTEN SOME 15 YEARS AFTER THE ALLEGED INVESTMENT, SAID THAT THE TOTAL INVESTMENT WAS $9,000 IN 2 STOCKS AND ONE OF THE STOCKS WENT TO 0.  SIMPLE DIVISION OF $9,000 DIVIDED BY 2 EQUALS $4,500 WHICH IS BELOW THE THRESHOLD FOR ENTERING COMPLAINTS ON A REGISISTERED REPS U-4."

OTHER_NAMES: [JOHN J HANLON IV, JOHN JOSEPH HANLON, SEAN  HANLON]
DISCLOSURE_INFO:
{
  "Allegations" : "AFTER YEARS OF SUCCESSFULLY ADVISING CLIENT ON A DIVERSIFIED PORTFOLIO, A SINGLE INVESTMENT RECOMMENDATION MADE IN 1989 WENT BAD IN 1990-91.  THE INVESTMENT WAS IN THE COMMON STOCK OF A LOCAL SAVINGS AND LOAN.  UNFORTUNATELY, THE SAVINGS AND LOAN WAS REPORTING FRAUDULENT FINANCIALS, FAILED AND WAS SEIZED BY THE RTC IN 1990.  ALL SHAREHOLDER EQUITY WAS LOST.  MR HANLON COULD NOT HAVE FORESEEN THIS, HOWEVER PAINE WEBBER AGREED TO COMPENSATE MR. [CUSTOMER]FOR SOME OF HIS LOSSES.  DELOITTE TOUCHE, THE ACCOUNTING FIRM FOR THE SAVINGS AND LOAN, ALSO AGREED TO COMPENSATE ALL INVESTORS UNDER A SETTLEMENT TO A CLASS ACTION SUIT.  CLEARLY, MR HANLON AND ALL INVOLVED INVESTORS WERE MISLEAD BY THE SAVINGS AND LOAN AND THE ACCOUNTING FIRM.",
  "Damage Amount Requested" : "$70,000.00",
  "Settlement Amount" : "$43,000.00",
  "DisplayAAOLinkIfExists" : "N",
  "arbitrationClaimFiledDetail" : "",
  "arbitrationDocketNumber" : ""
}
